Title: Indonesian Higher Education Learning Strategy Facing Industry 4.0: Program for Implementing the SPOCs Learning Model
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sudirwan, J., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pelawi, D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper aims to propose learning strategy in Indonesian Higher Education Institutions toward Education 4.0, This literature review study focuses on the selection of learning strategy with the MOOC models. The choice of strategy was based on the analysis of current issues of MOOCs implementation as opposed to the provision of Human Resource competencies facing Industry 4.0. Those strengths and weaknesses faced with opportunities for applying the MOOCs models that were compatible with the Higher Education environment operation, such as geographical and economic of the community. The result was SPOCs learning model as one model, which can meet current learning needs that are effective, flexible, accountable, and could be run within selected class whether face-to-face, online, blended or flipped class. © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Facings; Industry 4.0; Information management; Personnel; blended; Higher education; Higher education institutions; Human resource competencies; Learning models; Learning strategy; Literature reviews; SPOCs; Learning systems
